Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: mayor \may"or\, n. [OE. maire, F. maire, fr. L. major greater, higher, nobler, compar. of magnus great; cf. Sp. mayor. See {Major}, and cf. {Merino}.] The chief magistrate of a city or borough; the chief administrative officer of a municipal corporation. In some American cities there is a city court of which the major is chief judge. The post is usually elective, its holder chosen by the electorate of the entire city. [1913 Webster]
mayor n : the head of a city government [syn: {city manager}]
